title: How to Make a Lemon Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.
Grease and flour a round 9-inch cake pan.
Place the lemon slices in a mediums-sized saucepan and add the water.
Sprinkle in the salt an boil the mixture on high until the lemons are tender.
steps.description: Allow the lemons to boil for about 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Drain the lemons into a colander and allow the lemons to cool for about 5 minutes.
Blend the lemons with the lemon juice into a food processor.
steps.description: Blend on high speed until the mixture is smooth, taking about 2 minutes. Set aside.

steps.headline: In a separate large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
steps.description: Blend with an electric mixer for about 3-4 minutes.

steps.headline: Fold in the vanilla extra and crack in the eggs.
steps.description: Blend again until well-combined.

steps.headline: Whisk the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a separate medium-sized bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and remaining salt.

steps.headline: Slowly fold in the flour mixture along with the buttermilk.
steps.description: Carefully blend in the flour mixture by slowing pouring it in, mixing on low speed. Combine the buttermilk in with the cake batter and blend until there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Add in the lemon mixture and mix again until properly combined.
Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.
Bake the cake for about 35-40 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.
Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.
Serve.
steps.description: Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a  lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.
Grease and flour a round cake pan.
Sift the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, sift the flour, salt, and baking powder until light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Combine the yogurt, eggs, and sugar in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Beat well with a whisk until the batter starts to form.

steps.headline: Pour in the oil, zest, and lemon juice and beat again.
steps.description: The mixture will begin to turn frothy.

steps.headline: Fold in the wet ingredients in with the dry.
steps.description: Whisk again until the cake batter forms and there are no flour streaks.

steps.headline: Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.
Bake the cake for about 30-35 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.
Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.
Serve.
steps.description: Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit or 165° Celsius.
Grease and flour a cake bundt pan.
Sift the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, sift the flour, salt, and baking powder until light and fluffy.

steps.headline: In a separate bowl, cream the butter and sugar until fluffy.
steps.description: Add in the eggs and blend again with electric mixer.

steps.headline: Stir in the lemon juice, vanilla, sour cream, zest, and ginger.
steps.description: Blend again until well-combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the wet ingredients in with the dry and add the buttermilk.
steps.description: Slowly blend on low speed until the cake batter forms and there are no flour streaks.

steps.headline: Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.
Bake the cake for about 70-80 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.
Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.
Serve.
steps.description: Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.
Grease and flour a 8 or 9-inch cake pan.
Sift the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, sift the flour, salt, and baking powder until light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Pour in the sugar and mix until fully combined using a wooden spoon.
In a separate bowl, beat lemon zest, milk, vanilla extract, and oil.
steps.description: Whisk until properly combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the wet ingredients in with the dry and add the lemon juice.
steps.description: Blend well using a rubber spatula or electric mixer until there are no more flour streaks. The batter will look fizzy. This is normal.

steps.headline: Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.
Bake the cake for about 30-35 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.
Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.
Serve.
steps.description: Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.
Grease and flour a round 9-inch cake pan.
Sift the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, sift the flour, salt, and baking powder until light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Whisk the tofu with the wet ingredients and sugar.
steps.description: In a separate bowl, beat the tofu with the eggs, lemon zest, lemon juice, sugar, and vanilla extract. Beat until the mixture fully combined and slightly liquid-like.

steps.headline: Fold in the wet ingredients in with the dry and add the vegetable oil.
steps.description: Blend well using a rubber spatula or electric mixer until there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.
Bake the cake for about 75-85 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.
Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.
Serve.
steps.description: Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.
Whisk the milk and lemon juice together in a small bowl.
steps.description: Allow it to sit for about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: In a large bowl, stir the lemon zest and sugar together.
Add in the butter or oil, eggs, vanilla, and the milk mixture.
steps.description: Whisk well until properly blended.

steps.headline: Sift together the dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Sift the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together until light and fluffy,

steps.headline: Fold in the wet ingredients in with the dry and add the vegetable oil.
steps.description: Blend well using a rubber spatula or electric mixer until there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.
Bake the cake for about 20-25 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.
Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.
Serve.
steps.description: Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 320° Fahrenheit or 160° Celsius.
Grease and flour a cake pan.
Sift the dry ingredients together.
steps.description: Sift the baking soda, baking powder, vanilla powder, and salt together. Add the sugar and lemon zest.

steps.headline: Combine in the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Pour in the olive oil, water, vegan yogurt, melted vegan butter, and lemon juice. Mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.
Bake the cake for about 40-45 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.
Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.
Serve.
steps.description: Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy!

text: Basic Lemon Cake Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.  Grease and flour a round 9-inch cake pan.  Place the lemon slices in a mediums-sized saucepan and add the water.  Sprinkle in the salt an boil the mixture on high until the lemons are tender. Allow the lemons to boil for about 15 minutes. Drain the lemons into a colander and allow the lemons to cool for about 5 minutes.  Blend the lemons with the lemon juice into a food processor. Blend on high speed until the mixture is smooth, taking about 2 minutes. Set aside. In a separate large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Blend with an electric mixer for about 3-4 minutes. Fold in the vanilla extra and crack in the eggs. Blend again until well-combined. Whisk the dry ingredients. In a separate medium-sized bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and remaining salt. Slowly fold in the flour mixture along with the buttermilk. Carefully blend in the flour mixture by slowing pouring it in, mixing on low speed. Combine the buttermilk in with the cake batter and blend until there are no more flour streaks. Add in the lemon mixture and mix again until properly combined.  Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.  Bake the cake for about 35-40 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.  Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.  Serve. Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a  lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy! Moist & Fluffy Lemon Cake Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.  Grease and flour a round cake pan.  Sift the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, sift the flour, salt, and baking powder until light and fluffy. Combine the yogurt, eggs, and sugar in a separate bowl. Beat well with a whisk until the batter starts to form. Pour in the oil, zest, and lemon juice and beat again. The mixture will begin to turn frothy. Fold in the wet ingredients in with the dry. Whisk again until the cake batter forms and there are no flour streaks. Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.  Bake the cake for about 30-35 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.  Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.  Serve. Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy! Lemon Pound Cake Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit or 165° Celsius.  Grease and flour a cake bundt pan.  Sift the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, sift the flour, salt, and baking powder until light and fluffy. In a separate bowl, cream the butter and sugar until fluffy. Add in the eggs and blend again with electric mixer. Stir in the lemon juice, vanilla, sour cream, zest, and ginger. Blend again until well-combined. Fold in the wet ingredients in with the dry and add the buttermilk. Slowly blend on low speed until the cake batter forms and there are no flour streaks. Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.  Bake the cake for about 70-80 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.  Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.  Serve. Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy! Eggless Lemon Cake Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.  Grease and flour a 8 or 9-inch cake pan.  Sift the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, sift the flour, salt, and baking powder until light and fluffy. Pour in the sugar and mix until fully combined using a wooden spoon.  In a separate bowl, beat lemon zest, milk, vanilla extract, and oil. Whisk until properly combined. Fold in the wet ingredients in with the dry and add the lemon juice. Blend well using a rubber spatula or electric mixer until there are no more flour streaks. The batter will look fizzy. This is normal. Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.  Bake the cake for about 30-35 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.  Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.  Serve. Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy! Milkless Lemon Cake Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.  Grease and flour a round 9-inch cake pan.  Sift the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, sift the flour, salt, and baking powder until light and fluffy. Whisk the tofu with the wet ingredients and sugar. In a separate bowl, beat the tofu with the eggs, lemon zest, lemon juice, sugar, and vanilla extract. Beat until the mixture fully combined and slightly liquid-like. Fold in the wet ingredients in with the dry and add the vegetable oil. Blend well using a rubber spatula or electric mixer until there are no more flour streaks. Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.  Bake the cake for about 75-85 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.  Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.  Serve. Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy! Gluten-Free Lemon Cake Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.  Whisk the milk and lemon juice together in a small bowl. Allow it to sit for about 5 minutes. In a large bowl, stir the lemon zest and sugar together.  Add in the butter or oil, eggs, vanilla, and the milk mixture. Whisk well until properly blended. Sift together the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Sift the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together until light and fluffy, Fold in the wet ingredients in with the dry and add the vegetable oil. Blend well using a rubber spatula or electric mixer until there are no more flour streaks. Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.  Bake the cake for about 20-25 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.  Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.  Serve. Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy! Vegan Lemon Cake Preheat the oven to 320° Fahrenheit or 160° Celsius.  Grease and flour a cake pan.  Sift the dry ingredients together. Sift the baking soda, baking powder, vanilla powder, and salt together. Add the sugar and lemon zest. Combine in the wet ingredients. Pour in the olive oil, water, vegan yogurt, melted vegan butter, and lemon juice. Mix until well-combined. Scrape the cake batter into the cake pan using a rubber spatula.  Bake the cake for about 40-45 minutes until it has fully baked and is golden brown.  Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before serving.  Serve. Spread frosting, icing, lemon syrup, ice cream, or a lemon sauce over the cake before serving. You can also garnish with topping such as sour candies, fresh fruit, lemon wedges, and/or chocolate chips. Enjoy!
